item.title: US warship transits Taiwan Strait for second time in two weeks
item.description: A US Navy warship has transited the narrow and sensitive Taiwan Strait, the US Navy and Taiwan's Defense Ministry said on Monday, the second such operation in two weeks amid rising tensions between China and the United States.

item.title: White House: Trump to meet law enforcement in Kenosha, no plans to see Blake family
item.description: President Donald Trump does not have plans to meet with the family of Jacob Blake, a Black man who was shot by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin when he visits the city on Tuesday but will visit law enforcement officials, the White House said on Monday.

item.title: Syria says two killed, seven wounded in Israeli missile attack
item.description: A Syrian military source said that an Israeli missile attack on Syria killed two people, injured seven others and caused damage on Monday, state media reported.

item.title: WHO urges 'dialogue' with virus protesters
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) urged governments Monday to engage with people demonstrating against Covid-19 restrictions and listen to their concerns, but stressed protesters needed to understand the virus was dangerous.

item.title: Biden calls for end to 'lawlessness' in protest-hit US cities
item.description: Democratic White House hopeful Joe Biden on Monday called for an end to "lawlessness" and violence in protest-hit US cities, while blaming Donald Trump's "toxic" presidency for fueling the unrest that has left several people dead.

item.title: Opening up without control of COVID-19 is recipe for disaster, says WHO
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) called on countries to persevere with restrictions to tackle coronavirus disease (COVID-19), director general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said on Monday, saying opening up without control of the virus would be a "recipe for disaster".

item.title: Increase in COVID-19 cases observed in Iligan, Zamboanga cities -- Galvez
item.description: There has been a rise in cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in the cities of Iligan and Zamboanga partly due to locally stranded individuals (LSIs), the chief implementer of the government s pandemic response said Monday.

item.title: Duterte: Revolutionary gov't should be discussed in public, with soldiers
item.description: "'Yung unabated corruption and with no end in sight and another election coming up and you see the same old faces there... wala, patay," Duterte said. “Sabi ko nga yong revolutionary government should not be discussed in sub rosa. It should be discussed publicly, including the military."

item.title: 5 new COVID-19 cases reported in Tagbilaran City, Bohol
item.description: Five new cases of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) were recorded in Tagbilaran City on Monday night (August 31), Mayor John Geesnell Yap II confirmed.

item.title: Emergency authorization of COVID-19 vaccines needs great care --WHO
item.description: The emergency authorization of COVID-19 vaccines requires a "great deal of seriousness and reflection," the World Health Organization said on Monday.

item.title: 7-anyos na bata, nagtamo ng matinding sunog sa katawan nang tangkaing iligtas ang batang kapatid
item.description: Dahil sa nakasinding gasera na napabayaan, nasunog ang bahay ng pitong-taong-gulang na si Alvin sa Allen, Northen Samar. Ang tanging kasama niya noon sa bahay, ang apat na taong gulang niyang kapatid na babae na si Angelien.

item.title: Gierran vows to restore public s trust, confidence in PhilHealth
item.description: Retired National Bureau of Investigation director and newly appointed president of the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth) Dante Gierran on Monday vowed to restore the public s trust and confidence in the state health insurer.

item.title: Taunted and disrespected, gov't workers heroes too, says Briones
item.description: “We are celebrating National Heroes Day but I would nominate the person in government as a hero. Ang tao sa gobyerno, trabaho nang trabaho, kinakantiyawan, inaaway, binabastos, ina-accuse of corruption pero sige pa rin ng sige,” Briones said.

item.title: DepEd: 23.9M learners enrolled for upcoming school year
item.description: Over 23.9 million students have enrolled for the upcoming school year amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, Education Secretary Leonor Briones said on Monday.

item.title: 9-anyos na babae, patay sa tuklaw ng ahas sa kanilang bahay
item.description: Binawian ng buhay sa ospital ang isang babaeng siyam na taong gulang matapos siyang matuklaw ng ahas sa loob ng kanilang bahay sa San Carlos City, Pangasinan. Ang biktima, nagsusukat ng unipormeng gagamitin sa pasukan ng klase nang mangyari ang trahediya.
